titleStmt.title: A patterne of Christian loyaltie vvhereby any prudent man may clearely perceive, in what manner the new Oath of Allegiance, and every clause thereof, may in a true, and catholike sense, without danger of perjury, be taken by Roman Catholikes. And all the chiefe objections, which are usually made against the said Oath, either in particular, or in generall, may according to the grounds of Catholike religion bee easily answered. Collected out of authours, who have handled the whole matter more largely. By William Hovvard an English Catholike.
titleStmt.author: Preston, Thomas, 1563-1640.

notesStmt.note: A defense of the 1606 Oath of Allegiance, whose use was being renewed at this time. A different text from Preston's 1616 defense.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A" in a woodcut frame.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
